data.title: Fix CORS issue in production between backend and frontend
data.description:
# Screenshot(s)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4dcb8c59-ea1b-49c5-972d-86faa99382f8)

solved with updated SUPABASE_URL in backend env vars

# Checklist submission

- [x] pulled `main` branch to ensure latest version and no merge conflicts
- [x] ran `cd frontend; npm run build` and confirm no type errors
- Issue link: #218 

***

# problem statement

expecting sign up request to work in production

this feature works in development with localhost/ SQLite, but leads to CORS error in production with Vercel / Supabase PostrgreSQL:

```
Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'https://dottie-backend-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app/api/user/me' from origin 'https://dottie-lmcreans-projects.vercel.app' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: It does not have HTTP ok status.

```

# Debugging steps 

## 1. inspect environment vars

- [x] updated VITE_API_BASE_URL

frontend:
```
NODE_ENV
production
Added 2d ago


VITE_API_BASE_URL
https://•••••••••••.vercel.app ( no / at end, confirmed as correct)
Updated Apr 13 
````

## 2. inspect failed Post Req URL from CORS

<details>
<summary> click here to view </summary>

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a34d3fbb-a6f5-4717-966b-36363c5a6af4)

</details>

This Serverless Function has crashed.

Your connection is working correctly.

Vercel is working correctly.

500: INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR
Code: FUNCTION_INVOCATION_FAILED
ID: lhr1::88bz8-1745237856189-002c67c0f8cf

## 3. inspect backend logs

<details>
<summary> click here to view </summary>

```
Apr 21 13:17:38.51
GET
500
dottie-backend.vercel.app
/favicon.ico
Using Supabase database in production Error initializing Supabase: Error: supabaseUrl is required. at new SupabaseClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/SupabaseClient.js:43:19) at createClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/index.js:38:12) at initDB (file:///var/task/backend/db/database.js:31:24) at file:///var/task/backend/db/database.js:64:26 at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:271:25) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:578:26) at async d (/opt/rust/nodejs.js:16:18758) Error: supabaseUrl is required. at new SupabaseClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/SupabaseClient.js:43:19) at createClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/index.js:38:12) at file:///var/task/backend/services/supabaseService.js:50:14 at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:271:25) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:578:26) at async d (/opt/rust/nodejs.js:16:18758) Node.js process exited with exit status: 1. The logs above can help with debugging the issue.
Apr 21 13:17:36.18
GET
500
dottie-backend.vercel.app
/api/auth/signup
Using Supabase database in production Error initializing Supabase: Error: supabaseUrl is required. at new SupabaseClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/SupabaseClient.js:43:19) at createClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/index.js:38:12) at initDB (file:///var/task/backend/db/database.js:31:24) at file:///var/task/backend/db/database.js:64:26 at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:271:25) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:578:26) at async d (/opt/rust/nodejs.js:16:18758) Error: supabaseUrl is required. at new SupabaseClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/SupabaseClient.js:43:19) at createClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/index.js:38:12) at file:///var/task/backend/services/supabaseService.js:50:14 at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:271:25) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:578:26) at async d (/opt/rust/nodejs.js:16:18758) Node.js process exited with exit status: 1. The logs above can help with debugging the issue.
Apr 21 13:17:19.13
OPTIONS
500
dottie-backend.vercel.app
/api/auth/signup
Using Supabase database in production Error initializing Supabase: Error: supabaseUrl is required. at new SupabaseClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/SupabaseClient.js:43:19) at createClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/index.js:38:12) at initDB (file:///var/task/backend/db/database.js:31:24) at file:///var/task/backend/db/database.js:64:26 at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:271:25) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:578:26) at async d (/opt/rust/nodejs.js:16:18758) Error: supabaseUrl is required. at new SupabaseClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/SupabaseClient.js:43:19) at createClient (/var/task/backend/node_modules/@supabase/supabase-js/dist/main/index.js:38:12) at file:///var/task/backend/services/supabaseService.js:50:14 at ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:271:25) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:578:26) at async d (/opt/rust/nodejs.js:16:18758) Node.js process exited with exit status: 1. The logs above can help with debugging the issue.

```

</details>

## 4. inspect env vars in frontend

<details>
<summary> click here to view </summary>

```
SUPABASE_ANON_PUBLIC
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


SUPABASE_JWT_SECRET
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


NODE_ENV
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


AZURE_SQL_SERVER
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


AZURE_SQL_DATABASE
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


AZURE_SQL_USER
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


AZURE_SQL_PASSWORD
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


AZURE_SQL_CONNECTION_STRING
All Environments
•••••••••••••••

Added Apr 13


VITE_GEMINI_API_KEY
All Environments
•••••••••••••••
```

</details>

# 5. added missing SUPABASE_URL to backaend Vercel env vars

```
SUPABASE_URL = https://[your-project-id-here].supabase.co
```

##  6. redeployed backend

## 7. redeployed frontend

## 8. review console after manual test auth signup

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0f4066e9-d514-440f-8c70-10aa3f1e95ea)

# debugging checklist 
## production backend works as expected in isolation

- [x] redeploy backend to isolated domain with `vercel --prod`
- [x] confirm backend deployed as expected, specifically backend-auth

## backend integrates as expected

- [x] confirm latest CORS EM
- [x] confirm vercel.json and server.js have CORS set; regex searched for other CORS blockers
- [x] confirm frontend/src/api handles CORS as expected
- [x] redeploy frontend to isolated domain with `vercel --prod`
- [x] The backend/vercel.json file has appropriate CORS headers configured for all routes
- [x] The server.js file uses the cors middleware with proper configuration allowing specific origins (development and production domains)
- [x] Pre-flight OPTIONS requests are properly handled
- [x] The API client correctly sets up axios with the appropriate base URL
- [x] No client-side CORS issues found as the server properly sets CORS headers
- [x] The frontend doesn't need to explicitly handle CORS as it's properly configured on the server side

data.title: Fix build issues in frontend
data.description:
# acceptance criteria
`cd frontend; npm run build` works as expected with no EMs

# info
I've fixed the build issues by:

Updated the postLogout function in frontend/src/api/auth/requests/postLogout/Request.ts to make the userId parameter optional with a default empty string value

Fixed the updatePassword function in frontend/src/context/AuthContext.tsx to return a boolean value instead of trying to access a non-existent response.success property

Updated the handleLogout function in frontend/src/test_page/page.tsx to pass an empty string to authApi.logout("")

The build now completes successfully, and the development server is running. You should be able to access the application at http://localhost:3000/.

data.title: Integration(assessment): Fix 3 requests to render as expected in development
data.description:
# Screenshots 

list and detail view working

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5273b8ac-e71e-4f79-8b72-32e10b3533ca)

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a6f18cf1-b034-4493-a741-27058042d045)

# Task List

- [x] endpoints pass in `developer mode` tests
- [x] fix issue with categorisation between physical and emotional symptoms found in frontend
- [x] clarified formatting between snake_case and camelCase throughout dependency chain (see Readme-developers.md)
- [x] fix rendering of assessment in frontend

# chores
- [x] import tables fixed in Frontend around fullscreen chat

# ready to merge chores
- [ ] main branch pulled, no merge conflicts
- [ ] npm run build working in frontend
- [x] linked to issue
